subclassFeature.name: College of Chaos
entries: Während die meisten Barden ihre Fähigkeiten mit Worten nutzen, um zu unterhalten und zu unterstützen, ziehen es einige vor, Verwirrung, Fehlinformationen und Misstrauen zu verbreiten. Obwohl sie die Idee von Anführern ablehnen, schließen sich einige Barden dem College of Chaos an, einer führerlosen Vereinigung von Misanthropen, die diskordante Magie studieren.

subclassFeature.name: Sower of Discord
entries: Wenn du dem Kolleg des Chaos auf Stufe 3 beitrittst, erhältst du die Fertigkeiten, um besser Zwietracht unter deinen Feinden zu säen. Du erhältst Fertigkeiten in {@item disguise kit|PHB|Disguise Kits}, {@item forgery kit|PHB|Forgery Kits} und {@item Thieves' Tools|PHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Bewildering Whispers
entries: Ab Stufe 3 kannst du lernen, mitten im Kampf Verwirrung zu stiften. Wenn eine Kreatur im Umkreis von 60 Fuß, die dich sehen oder hören kann, einen Angriffswurf macht, kannst du als Reaktion "Bardische Inspiration verbrauchen" einsetzen, um sie zu einem Rettungswurf in Weisheit zu zwingen. Bei einem misslungenen Schutzwurf muss die Kreatur ihren Angriff gegen eine andere Kreatur deiner Wahl in ihrer Reichweite einsetzen.

subclassFeature.name: Pandemonium
entries: Ab der 6. Stufe verströmt dein Gegenzauber chaotische Magie. Wenn du deinen Gegenzauber einsetzt, kannst du eine Kreatur innerhalb des Effekts dazu zwingen, einen Rettungswurf in Weisheit zu machen. Bei einem misslungenen Schutzwurf wirfst du einen d10. Das Ziel erleidet bis zum Ende deines Gegenzaubers den Effekt aus der Tabelle Pandemonium.

Eine Kreatur, die unter diesem Effekt leidet, kann zu Beginn jeder ihrer Runden einen Rettungswurf in Weisheit machen, der den Effekt bei einem Erfolg beendet. Sobald eine Kreatur ihren Rettungswurf erfolgreich absolviert hat, ist sie für die nächsten 24 Stunden immun gegen diese Eigenschaft.

entries.caption: Pandemonium
rows: Sie ziehen sich in ihren Geist zurück und sind {@condition Paralyzed}. Der Effekt endet vorzeitig, wenn sie Schaden nehmen.
Sie sind {@condition Incapacitated} und davon überzeugt, dass ihre Verbündeten heimlich ein Komplott gegen sie schmieden.
Sie sind {@condition Frightened} der nächstgelegenen Kreatur und nutzen ihren Zug, um vor ihr zu fliehen.
Sie können nicht sprechen oder zaubern und haben das Gefühl, dass ihre Stimme entweicht, wenn sie den Mund öffnen.
Sie erleben lebhafte Halluzinationen und haben bei allen Angriffswürfen einen Nachteil.
Sie sind sehr beeinflussbar und tun alles, was man ihnen sagt und was nicht selbstzerstörerisch ist.
Sie haben einen unstillbaren Hunger und nutzen ihre Aktion, um alles zu essen, was sie kriegen können.
Sie nutzen ihren Zug, um ihren vorherigen Zug oder ihre vorherige Aktion so gut es geht zu wiederholen.
Sie zittern wild und haben einen Nachteil bei allen Stärke- und Geschicklichkeitsüberprüfungen und Rettungswürfen.
Ihre Augen werden tiefschwarz und sie sind völlig {@condition Blinded} und {@condition Deafened|PHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Reign of Chaos
entries: Du hast die chaotische Magie gemeistert, die die Quelle deiner Macht ist. Auf der 14. Stufe erlernst du den Zauber {@spell confusion|PHB}, der jedoch nicht auf deine Gesamtanzahl an bekannten Zaubern angerechnet wird. Wenn du bereits {@spell confusion|PHB} kennst, lernst du einen weiteren Verzauberungszauber deiner Wahl aus der Zauberliste des Link-Barden.
Als Bonusaktion in deinem Zug kannst du eine bardische Inspiration aufwenden, um {@spell confusion|PHB} mit den folgenden Änderungen zu wirken:

items: Du kannst nur eine Kreatur mit dem Zauberspruch anvisieren.
Der Zauber erfordert nicht deine Konzentration, aber du kannst nicht mehr als eine Instanz des Zaubers aktiv haben.
Wenn eine Kreatur einen Rettungswurf macht, um den Effekten dieses Zaubers zu widerstehen, kannst du eine bardische Inspiration ausgeben, um dem Rettungswurf einen Nachteil aufzuerlegen.

subclassFeature.name: College of Command
entries: Barden, die sich dem College of Command anschließen, lernen, ihre starke Persönlichkeit und ihr Selbstvertrauen zu nutzen, um andere zu Heldentaten im Kampf zu inspirieren. Anstatt ihre Fähigkeiten zu nutzen, um sich selbst zu stärken, bringen sie das Beste in ihren Verbündeten hervor.

Für einige Barden-Kommandanten liegen die Tage des tapferen Heldentums schon lange hinter ihnen und es ist an der Zeit, die Fackel an die nächste Generation weiterzugeben. Andere führen ihre Soldaten von der Front aus, erteilen Befehle und ziehen die Schwerter an ihrer Seite.

subclassFeature.name: Tactical Training
entries: Du hast deinen Körper für den Kampf trainiert und die strategischen Instinkte deines Geistes geschärft. Mit dem Eintritt in dieses Kollegium auf Stufe 3 erlangst du die Beherrschung von mittelschweren Rüstungen, Schilden und allen Kampfwaffen, denen die Eigenschaft "schwer" fehlt.
Zusätzlich erhältst du die Beherrschung von zwei Spielsets deiner Wahl und kannst den doppelten Beherrschungsbonus auf jede Fähigkeitsprüfung addieren, die diese Spielsets verwendet.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Commands
entries: Ab der 3. Stufe kannst du eine bardische Inspiration aufwenden, um einen der folgenden Befehle zu erteilen, der sich an eine willige Kreatur innerhalb von 60 Fuß richtet, die dich sehen oder hören kann:

items: {@italic {@bold Attack Order.}} Als Aktion befiehlst du einer verbündeten Kreatur, in die Offensive zu gehen. Wenn diese Kreatur das nächste Mal vor Beginn deines nächsten Zuges die Aktion Angriff ausführt, kann sie als Teil dieser Aktion eine zusätzliche Waffenattacke durchführen.

{@italic {@bold Defensive Order.}} Wenn eine verbündete Kreatur von einem Angriff getroffen wird, kannst du ihr mit deiner Reaktion befehlen, sich zu verteidigen. Das Ziel erhält einen Bonus auf seine Rüstungsklasse in Höhe eines Wurfes deiner bardischen Inspiration gegen den auslösenden Angriff, der bis zum Beginn deines nächsten Zuges anhält.

{@italic {@bold Rallying Order.}} Als Aktion befiehlst du einer verbündeten Kreatur, sich auf dem Schlachtfeld strategisch neu zu positionieren. Das Ziel kann seine Reaktion nutzen, um sich sofort auf seine volle Bewegungsgeschwindigkeit zu bewegen, ohne Gelegenheitsangriffe zu provozieren.

{@italic {@bold Steadfast Order.}} Als Aktion befiehlst du einem Verbündeten, sich zu wehren und kein Pardon zu geben. Jedes Mal, wenn das Ziel vor Beginn deines nächsten Zuges eine Stärke-, Konstitutions- oder Geschicklichkeitsprüfung oder einen Rettungswurf macht, erhält es einen Bonus auf seinen Wurf in Höhe eines Wurfes deiner bardischen Inspiration.

subclassFeature.name: Gallant Leader
entries: Du kannst nahtlos kämpfen und Befehle erteilen. Ab der 6. Stufe kannst du, wenn du deine Aktion benutzt, um einen Befehl zu erteilen, einen Waffenangriff als Bonusaktion in dieser Runde durchführen.
Außerdem hast du Vorteil bei Rettungswürfen, um den {@condition charmed} und {@condition frightened} Zuständen zu widerstehen.

subclassFeature.name: Masterful Commander
entries: Deine selbstbewussten Befehle ermutigen deine Verbündeten. Ab Stufe 14 kannst du jedes Mal, wenn du einen Befehl erteilst, einen {@dice d6} würfeln und ihn verwenden, anstatt einen bardischen Inspirationswürfel auszugeben.

subclassFeature.name: College of The Crossroads
entries: Während die meisten Barden von Natur aus gute Musiker, Sänger oder Geschichtenerzähler sind, erlangen einige ihr Talent durch schändlichere Mittel. Diese Organisation, die informell als College of the Crossroads bekannt ist, wurde nach dem traditionellen Ort benannt, an dem solche sterblichen Abmachungen getroffen werden. Eine Vereinbarung mit einem Teufel, Dämon oder einem anderen Bewohner der niederen Dimensionen ist nur der Anfang des Strebens eines solchen Barden nach persönlicher Macht und Ruhm.

subclassFeature.name: Infernal Musician
entries: Du hast an der Kreuzung seltsame und unheimliche Fähigkeiten erworben. Wenn du diesem Kollegium auf Stufe 3 beitrittst, erhältst du die Fertigkeit Darbietung und lernst, in {@language Infernal}, der Sprache der Teufel, zu sprechen, zu lesen, zu schreiben und zu singen.

Außerdem erhältst du jedes Mal, wenn du eine Charisma- ({@skill Deception}), Charisma- ({@skill Performance}) oder Charisma- ({@skill Persuasion})-Überprüfung durchführst, die höllische Sprache oder Lyrik beinhaltet, einen Bonus auf deinen Wurf in Höhe deines bardischen Inspirationswürfels.

subclassFeature.name: Forbidden Arcana
entries: Deine ruchlosen Geschäfte mit den niederen Dimensionen haben dir Zugang zu dunkler und böser Magie verschafft. Ab der 3. Stufe, wenn du einen Bardenzauber lernst, kannst du den neuen Zauber aus einem der beiden {@filter the warlock or the bard spell list|spells|class=bard;warlock} wählen. Jeder Zauber, den du mit dieser Eigenschaft erlernst, wird für dich zu einem Bardenzauber.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Recovery
entries: Ab der 6. Stufe kannst du auf die dunklen Künste zurückgreifen, um dein magisches Potenzial zu regenerieren, ähnlich wie ein Hexenmeister es tut. Wenn du eine kurze Pause machst, kannst du einen verbrauchten Bardenzauber-Slot zurückgewinnen. Die Stufe des wiedergewonnenen Zaubers darf deinen Charisma-Modifikator nicht überschreiten (mindestens Stufe 1).
Wenn du diese Eigenschaft während einer kurzen Ruhepause einsetzt, erhalten sowohl du als auch deine Verbündeten nicht die Vorteile deines Liedes der Ruhe.

subclassFeature.name: Otherworldly Virtuoso
entries: Du bist gekommen, um die infernalische Macht zu meistern, die in dir fließt. Ab Stufe 14 kannst du, wenn du einen Bardenzauber mit einer verbalen Komponente wirkst, eine bardische Inspiration aufwenden, um den Zauber auf eine der folgenden Arten zu verbessern:

items: {@italic {@bold Emboldening Melody.}} If the spell restores hit points, one target regains additional hit points equal to your Charisma modifier. All targets of the spell have advantage on the first attack roll, ability check, or saving throw they make.
{@italic {@bold Infectious Tune.}} If the spell requires concentration, you have advantage on the first Constitution saving throw you make to maintain concentration on the spell.

{@italic {@bold Resounding Note.}} If the spell deals damage, you can choose for it to become thunder damage. Large or smaller creatures effected by the spell must make an (additional) Strength saving throw. On a failed save, they fall prone.

subclassFeature.name: College of Drama
entries: Long have the performing arts been a favorite pastime for people of all walks of life. Performers and thespians use the stage to tell stories that while fictional, can reveal great truths about life, death, and the struggles in between. The Muse, the ancient spirit of inspiration, moves the hearts of these actors, both great and small, to give their all in every performance.

subclassFeature.name: Channel the Muse
entries: When you adopt the College of Drama at 3rd level, you can channel the Muse to magically manifest two different masks. One, a laughing mask of comedy, the other, a weeping mask of tragedy. At the end of a long rest, you choose which mask you wish to manifest, gaining abilities based on your choice.

items: {@italic {@bold Mask of Comedy.}} You use your talent for the dramatic to inspire your allies in combat. As a reaction, when a friendly creature within 30 feet is forced to make a saving throw, you can expend a bardic inspiration die, adding it from the result of their saving throw. You can use this reaction after they roll, but before you know whether they succeed or fail.

{@italic {@bold Mask of Tragedy.}} Your flair for tragedy allows you to inflict sorrow upon your foes. As a reaction, when a creature within 30 feet is forced to make a saving throw, you can expend a bardic inspiration die, subtracting it from the result of their saving throw. You can use this reaction after they roll, but before you know whether their roll succeeds or fails.

subclassFeature.name: Thespian's Craft
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the skills of a master stage performer. You gain proficiency in both the {@skill Performance} skill and {@item disguise kit|PHB|disguise kits}. If you are already proficient in Performance you instead gain proficiency in another skill of your choice. Also, while you are wearing a disguise, you have advantage on any Charisma (Performance) checks you make.

subclassFeature.name: Soliloquy
entries: Your ability to deliver impassioned performances empowers your Countercharm. Starting at 6th level, your Countercharm gains additional effects, based on the mask you are wearing:

items: {@italic {@bold Mask of Comedy.}} The sound of your Countercharm inspires great deeds. Creatures of your choice that can hear your Countercharm gain temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) at the start of each of their turns. In addition, they add {@dice 1d4} to any ability checks or attack rolls they make while they hear your Countercharm.

{@italic {@bold Mask of Tragedy.}} Your Countercharm undermines your enemies' resolve. Creatures of your choice that can hear your Countercharm have disadvantage on saving throws to resist being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}, and they must subtract {@dice 1d4} from any ability checks or attack rolls they make.

subclassFeature.name: Final Curtain
entries: The Muse grants you the ability to enthrall death itself, if only for a short while. Upon reaching 14th level, your masks gain the following features while you are wearing them:

items: {@italic {@bold Mask of Comedy.}} You can bring allies back from the brink of death. As a reaction when a creature you can see within 30 feet makes a death saving throw, you can expend a bardic inspiration die to make a Charisma (Performance) check, substituting the result of your roll for their death saving throw. If the result is 20 or greater, the creature regains hit points equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

{@italic {@bold Mask of Tragedy.}} You can bargain with death itself for more time. When you fall to 0 hit points, you can expend a bardic inspiration die to make a Charisma (Performance) check before you fall unconscious. If the result of your roll is a 20 or greater, you fall to 1 hit point instead of 0.

subclassFeature.name: College of Eulogies
entries: Bards are masters of eliciting all types of emotion. They use their musical magic to make audiences feel longing for places they have never been and love for people long dead. Those who join the College of Eulogies have a fondness for the more negative emotions; grief, sorrow, and horror. They take their name from the speeches typically delivered in memory of the deceased, for they see themselves as bringers of death.
Combined with a talent for necromancy magic, Eulogy bards wield the power of fear and despair to fill their foe's hearts with horror and bind restless spirits to their will.

subclassFeature.name: Bardic Dirge
entries: You wield the melancholic magic of negative emotions, and can use it to inflict minor curses. Starting at 3rd level, when a creature within 60 feet who can hear you, makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can expend a bardic inspiration as a reaction to impose disadvantage on their roll.

subclassFeature.name: Lament For The Dead
entries: When you join the College of Eulogies at 3rd level, you steep yourself in the lore magic associated with death. Whenever you make an ability check to recall knowledge about rituals related to death, undead, or the magic of necromancy, you can add double your proficiency bonus to your roll.
Also, whenever you learn a bard spell, you can choose to learn a {@filter necromancy spell of your choice from any spell list.|spells|school=N}

subclassFeature.name: Restless Spirit
entries: At 6th level, you can summon and bind the Restless Spirits of those who died with unfinished business. At the end of a long rest, you can perform a short ritual that summons such a spirit. A Spirit bound in this way is friendly to you, obeys your commands, and uses the {@creature Restless Spirit|LL:BC|Restless Spirit stat block}. The stat block uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places.

In combat, the Spirit acts during your turn. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes is the Dodge action, unless you used a bonus action on your turn to command it to take an action from its stat block, or another action. If you are incapacitated, it takes any action it chooses.
If your Spirit was destroyed within the last hour, you can expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher. After 1 minute, it returns from beyond the veil with all its hit points restored.

subclassFeature.name: Infectious Despair
entries: The sadness and despair that you inflict upon your enemies cloys to them until it exacts its toll. Beginning at 14th level, when you use your Bardic Dirge reaction on a creature, and that creature succeeds on its roll despite the disadvantage, they have disadvantage on the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw they make as well.
Regardless of the outcome of the second roll, this feature ends after their next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: College of Fools
entries: Bards who join the College of Fools use crude stories, daring acrobatics, and cutting jokes to entertain audiences, ranging from the crowds in a tavern to the nobles of a royal court. Where other bards seek out forgotten lore or tales of epic bravery, Fools ferret out embarrassing and hilarious stories of all kinds. Whether telling the tale of a stable hand's affair with a duchess or a mocking satire of a paladin's innocence, a Fool never lets social decorum get in the way of truth.

Fools adventure to undermine the plans of the powerful and arrogant. Among bards, Fools are unmatched acrobats, and their ability to tumble, dodge, leap, and climb makes them slippery opponents in battle.

subclassFeature.name: Satirical Theatrics
entries: When you adopt the College of Fools at 3rd level, you gain the skills necessary to pass as a bumbling nincompoop. You gain proficiency in the {@skill Acrobatics} and {@skill Sleight of Hand} skills. If you are already proficient in either of these skills   you instead gain proficiency in {@skill Deception} or {@item Thieves' Tools|PHB}.
In addition, whenever you make a Dexterity (Acrobatics) or Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check, you gain a bonus to your roll equal to your bardic inspiration die.

subclassFeature.name: Tumbling Fool
entries: Your training allows you to move about in strange and bizarrely entertaining ways. Starting at 3rd level, you can take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action on your turn. When you take the Dash action, you gain the following benefits, which last until the end of your current turn:

items: Opportunity attacks against you are made at disadvantage.
You gain a climbing speed equal to your movement speed.
You reduce any falling damage you take by an amount equal to your bard level + your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Sharp Tongue
entries: At 6th level you learn the {@spell vicious mockery} cantrip, but it doesn't count against your total number of Cantrips Known. If you already know vicious mockery you learn an another bard cantrip of your choice. When you damage a creature with vicious mockery, you gain a bonus to the damage roll equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Sharper Wit
entries: Starting at 6th level, when a creature that you can see targets you with a weapon or spell attack, you can use your reaction to cast {@spell vicious mockery} targeting the attacker. If the attacker fails their saving throw, they must choose another target within range of their attack. If there are no other creatures in range then their weapon or spell attack misses.
You can cast {@spell vicious mockery} as a reaction a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Fools Luck
entries: You have reached the pinnacle of the satirical performing arts. Upon reaching 14th level, you can combine your bardic magic with foolish antics to manipulate luck. When you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw with advantage, you can choose to automatically fail in comical fashion.

Once you've used this ability to purposefully fail, you gain 1 point of Fools Luck. You can have a number of points of Fools Luck equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). Any unused Fools Luck fades at the end of your next long rest.

When a creature within 30 feet that can hear you, makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can use your reaction to expend a charge of Fools Luck and impose advantage or disadvantage (your choice) on the roll.

subclassFeature.name: College of Glory
entries: Bards are known for telling the tales and ballads that laud the heroic action of others. While most are satisfied with this role, others strive to be the hero themselves. Many brave bards have joined the College of Glory for such a reason.

Valuing bravery and decisive action above all, members of the College of Glory strive to emulate the heroes of legend. Augmented by their magic, Glory bards cultivate larger than life persona and hone their physical abilities to match.

subclassFeature.name: Heroic Stature
entries: You have decided to become the hero that other bards will sing of. Beginning at 3rd level, you gain the following benefits when you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield:

items: Your bravery protects you. Your Armor Class is equal to 10 + your Strength modifier + your Charisma modifier.
Your unarmed strikes deal bludgeoning damage equal to your bardic inspiration die + your Strength modifier.
When you make a Strength (Athletics) check or roll damage for an unarmed strike, you can expend a bardic inspiration and add it to the result of your roll.

subclassFeature.name: Glorious Purpose
entries: You have trained to overcome any obstacle that may stand in the path of your glorious legend. When you join this College at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in {@skill Athletics} and you have advantage on saving throws to resist being {@condition frightened}.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn. Moreover, you can cast one of your cantrips in place of one of those attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Hero of Legend
entries: You to take up the mantle of a legendary hero. Starting at 14th level, you can use a bonus action to take on a heroic form, gaining the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: You gain temporary hit points equal to your bard level.
You can take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action so long as you end your movement closer to a hostile creature.
As a reaction when a creature targets you with a melee attack, you can make one attack against that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Paragon of Glory
entries: Your desire to become a true legend will never die. Beginning at 14th level, you are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition, and whenever you make a death saving throw you can choose to expend a bardic inspiration and add it to your roll.

subclassFeature.name: College of Radiance
entries: Worship takes on many forms across the multiverse; the quiet contemplation of the monastic hermit, the insightful guidance of the temple priest, the resolute dedication of the faith-filled zealot, and the impassioned preacher spreading the tenants of their faith across the land with word and song.

Radiance bards are devout preachers of the divine, and all their performances sing the praise of their deity. For good or ill, these bards use the power of their voice to further the will of their god, and inspire devotion in their mortal followers.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Revelation
entries: Your deity has blessed you with a measure of their divine power in return for your service. When you join this College at 3rd level, choose a Divine Domain from the cleric class that best fits the deity you serve. When you learn a bard spell, you can choose the spell from spell list of your Divine Domain, the cleric spell list, or the bard spell list. You must otherwise obey all restrictions for learning a new spell. Upon learning a new spell in this way it becomes a bard spell for you.
You also gain proficiency in the {@skill Religion} skill and can add double your proficiency bonus to any Intelligence (Religion) check you make related to your deity and their teachings.

subclassFeature.name: Words of Healing
entries: Starting at 3rd level, the divine power you serve empowers your healing. When you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher that restores hit points to a creature, they regain additional hit points equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Chorus Of The Divine
entries: Your faith empowers your magic. Beginning at 6th level, when you use your Countercharm feature, you can expend a use of bardic inspiration to empower it with one of the following celestial effects:

items: {@italic {@bold Guidance.}} Creatures of your choice under the effect of your Countercharm gain a bonus to their next ability check, attack roll, or saving throw they make before the start of your next turn equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1)

{@italic {@bold Judgement.}}  A creature of your choice within 30 feet that can hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they are {@condition frightened} of you until the start of your next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, or the effect ends for it, it is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.
{@italic {@bold Protection.}} Creatures of your choice under the effect of your Countercharm gain resistance to necrotic and radiant damage, and their maximum hit points can't be reduced.

{@italic {@bold Restoration}} When you begin your Countercharm, roll a bardic inspiration die. As part of the same action you can distribute temporary hit points equal to the amount you rolled on the bardic inspiration die to creatures of your choice under the effect of your Countercharm.

subclassFeature.name: Beatific Vision
entries: Your connection to the divine is so strong that you can allow the power of your deity to shine forth from you, causing your enemies to falter. Upon reaching 14th level, when you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher that forces a creature to make a saving throw, you can expend a use of bardic inspiration to impose disadvantage on one target's saving throw.
You can expend more than one bardic inspiration as part of this ability, imposing disadvantage on one creature's saving throw for each additional bardic inspiration you expend.

subclassFeature.name: College of Revelry
entries: Some bards have a way of becoming the center of attention wherever they go. They enjoy the after parties more than their performances, and it is rare that they turn down an invitation for a good time. From formal of banquets of royalty to the harvest celebrations of small farming towns, Revelry bards live for parties and hedonistic gatherings of all kinds.

subclassFeature.name: Charming Presence
entries: Upon joining the College of Revelry at 3rd level, your natural charisma makes other people uniquely comfortable around you. You gain proficiency in the {@skill Persuasion} skill. If you are already proficient in Persuasion you instead gain proficiency in your choice of {@skill Deception}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Sleight of Hand}.

If you are currently carousing with a creature, you have advantage on any Deception, Performance, Persuasion, or Sleight of Hand checks you make directed at that creature. For the purposes of this feature, carousing could be any of the following activities: drinking, dancing, feasting, partying, gambling, and any other activity that lowers inhibitions.

subclassFeature.name: Depraved Enchantments
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your very voice drips with debilitating pleasure and weakens the mental resolve of your foes. When you cast an enchantment spell of 1st-level or higher that has a verbal component, you can expend a use of bardic inspiration to impose disadvantage on the target's saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Stirring Performance
entries: our presence during rests enlivens your allies and assuages their worries. Beginning at 6th level, creatures that benefit from your Song of Rest during a short rest regain additional hit points equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).
Also, any creature that benefits from your Song of Rest during a short rest has advantage on the first ability check, attack roll, or saving throw they make after their short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Hedonistic Trance
entries: Your words and songs send creatures into a state of ecstasy. Starting at 14th level, you can use your action to expend a bardic inspiration and force a creature that can hear you within 30 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition stunned} for one minute. If the creature takes damage, they may immediately repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the creature's saving throw is successful, or the effect ends for it, it is immune to the effects of your Hedonistic Trance for the next 24 hours.
While stunned, the creature is in state of pure ecstasy of your choosing. It could be a drunken stupor, uncontrollable laughter, sensual hallucinations, or overwhelming pleasure.
When you use this feature, you can choose to expend an additional use of bardic inspiration to impose disadvantage on the target's initial saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: College of The Wilds
entries: Some bards are so inspired by the majesty of nature that they draw their musical magic from nature itself. Often more at home in nature then on the stage, bards who join the College of the Wilds feel a special kinship with plants and animals of all kinds. They can use their enchanting music to soothe even the most savage beasts, turning them from enemy to ally.

subclassFeature.name: Friend of Nature
entries: When you join this College at 3rd level, you gain the skills to charm and subdue plants and animals of all kinds. You gain proficiency in both {@skill Animal Handling} and {@skill Performance}, and Animal Handling becomes a Charisma-based skill for you.
Also, when you cast an enchantment spell that can target only humanoids, you can target beasts and plants as well.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Inspiration
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use a bonus action to expend a bardic inspiration and grant one of the bestial effects below to a creature within 60 feet. These abilities last for one hour, and end early if the creature chooses to end the effect, you grant them another bestial ability, or they are incapacitated.

items: {@italic {@bold Flight of the Squirrel.}} The creature sprouts lightweight flaps or fins. When they fall, they can subtract 60 feet from their fall when calculating fall damage, and they can move horizontally 2 feet for every 1 foot they fall.
{@italic {@bold Grip of the Monkey.}} The creature gains the ability to grip almost any surface. They gain a 30 foot climbing speed and have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to grapple.
{@italic {@bold Speed of the Deer.}} The creature's legs grow and their pace quickens. Their movement speed increases by 15 feet.
{@italic {@bold Swiftness of the Dolphin.}} The creature grows webbing between their digits. They gain a 30 foot swimming speed and can hold their breath underwater for up to 1 hour.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Companion
entries: Beginning at 6th level, when you finish a long rest, you can call a creature of the wild to you. A beast or plant of your choice native to the area appears and is friendly to you and your companions and obeys you completely. In combat, it shares your turn in initiative order, and can move and use its reaction on its own, but it can only take the dodge action unless you use your bonus action to command it to take the an action from its stat block or another action.
Your bard level determines the maximum CR of the beast or plant you can summon, as shown in the Companion table.

If your companion has died within the past hour, you can touch it and expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher and it returns to life with all of its hit points restored. You can only control one Companion at a time with this feature. Calling a second Companion causes the first to flee into the wild.

subclassFeature.name: Soothe the Savage Beast
entries: Your mastery of music and intimate knowledge of wild beasts allows you to soothe any creature, no matter how savage they are. Starting at 14th level, you can target monstrosities with enchantment spells that normally target only humanoids.

Also, you learn the {@spell dominate beast} spell. It counts as a bard spell for you, but it doesn't count against your total number of Spells Known. You can cast dominate beast once at 4th-level, without expending a spell slot. Once it is cast in this way, you must finish a short or long rest before you can do so again.

monster.name: Restless Spirit

hp.special: 5 + five times your bard level (the spirit has a number of hit dice [d8s]  equal to your bard level)

languages: the spirit understands the languages you speak

trait.name: Misery's Company
entries: The spirit has advantage on any attack rolls against creature {@condition frightened} of it.

trait.name: Spirit Bond
entries: You can add your PB to any ability check or saving throw that the spirit makes.

action.name: Mournful Wail.
entries: The Spirit sings a sorrowful song. A creature of your choice within 30 feet that can hear it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be {@condition frightened} of the Spirit for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Spectral Weapon
entries: {@atk mw}  your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 2 + PB}) necrotic damage.
